    "name": "Semiprimes generated by the Euler polynomial x^2 + x + 41.",
    "comment": [
        "This is a subsequence of A145292. The first numbers in A145292 but not in here are 176861, 186233, 241613, 242597, ..."
    ],
    "link": [
        "Shyam Sunder Gupta and K. D. Bajpai, <a href=\"/A228183/b228183.txt\">Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000</a> (first 4760 terms from Shyam Sunder Gupta)"
    ],
    "example": [
        "The semiprime 1763 = 41^2 + 41 + 41 = 41*43 is in the sequence."
    ],
    "mathematica": [
        "a = {}; Do[If[PrimeOmega[x^2 + x + 41] == 2, AppendTo[a, x^2 + x + 41]], {x, 1, 200}]; a",
        "(* For the b-file: *) n = 0; Do[t = k^2 + k + 41; If[PrimeOmega[t] == 2, n++; Print[n, \" \", t]], {k, 30000}] (* _K. D. Bajpai_, Apr 22 2014 *)"
    ],
    "program": [
        "(MAGMA) IsSemiprime:=func<i | &+[d[2]: d in Factorization(i)] eq 2>; [s: x in [2..200] | IsSemiprime(s) where s is x^2+x+41]; // _Bruno Berselli_, Aug 15 2013"
    ],
    "xref": [
        "Cf. A001358, A145292."
    ],
